0:
--------------------
Text: Owasso Independent School District v. Falvo, 534 U.S. 426 (2002) , was a case in which the United States Supreme Court held in favor of the school district that students scoring each other's tests and calling out the grades do not violate the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act of 1974 (FERPA).
Triplets:<Owasso Independent School District v. Falvo
1:
--------------------
Text: Owasso Independent School District v. Falvo:  Justice Kennedy wrote the opinion for the unanimous court.
Triplets:<Justice Kennedy
2:
Text: Owasso Independent School District v. Falvo:  Justice Scalia wrote a concurring opinion in which he agreed with the ruling, but took issue with parts of Kennedy's opinion.
Triplets:<Justice Scalia
